edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model

Class Trail

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model.Trail
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Trail>

    public class Trail
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Comparable<Trail>
    An object representing a Trail contained by a Park. Trails have a composition relationship with TrailList i.e. in the context of the GetOutdoors application, Trail objects are only constructed through the TrailList class. This helps to keep track of Trail IDs upon Trail construction. Trail is an OBSERVABLE class and is observed by TrailList. Trails are also comparable by their name field.
    Author:
    Noah Benveniste

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Trail(java.lang.String trailId, java.lang.String trailName, SortedArrayList<Activity> activities, boolean closedForMaintenance, double snow, double distance, Difficulty difficulty)
      Constructs a Trail object given an identifier, a name, a list of available activities for that Trail, the Trail's maintenance status (true if the Trail is closed for maintenance), the amount of snow on the Trail, the length of the Trail, and the Trail's difficulty (see edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.enums.Difficulty) Observers of Trail are notified of construction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trail

        public Trail(java.lang.String trailId,
             java.lang.String trailName,
             SortedArrayList<Activity> activities,
             boolean closedForMaintenance,
             double snow,
             double distance,
             Difficulty difficulty)
        Constructs a Trail object given an identifier, a name, a list of available activities for that Trail, the Trail's maintenance status (true if the Trail is closed for maintenance), the amount of snow on the Trail, the length of the Trail, and the Trail's difficulty (see edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.enums.Difficulty) Observers of Trail are notified of construction.
        Parameters:
        trailId - the Trail's unique identifer. Within the context of GetOutdoors, this field is generated by TrailList
        trailName - the Trail's name; used to sort/compare Trails
        activities - a SortedArrayList of available activities for the Trail
        closedForMaintenance - the Trail's maintenance status (true if closed, false if open)
        snow - the amount of snow on the Trail
        distance - the length of the Trail
        difficulty - the Trail's level of difficulty

        public void setActivities(SortedArrayList<Activity> activities)
        Sets the Activities available to be performed on the Trail. Observers of Trail are notified of this change if the Trail has been constructed.

        Throws:

      • setTrailMaintenance

        public void setTrailMaintenance(boolean closedForMaintenance)
        Sets the Trail's maintenance status. Observers of Trail are notified of the change if this method is called subsequently to construction.
        Parameters:
        closedForMaintenance - true if the Trail is closed for maintenance, false otherwise

      • setSnow

        public void setSnow(double snow)
        Sets the amount of snow on the Trail. If the passed argument is negative, the amount is set to 0. Observers of Trail are notified of the change if this method is called subsequently to construction.
        Parameters:
        snow - the amount of snow on the Trail.

      • addSnow

        public double addSnow(double snowChange)
        Adds a specified amount of snow to the current level of snow on the Trail. If the sum would result in a negative value, the amount is set to 0. Observers of Trail are notified of the change if this method is called subsequently to construction.
        Parameters:
        snowChange - the amount of snow to add to the Trail
        Returns:
        the new total amount of snow on the Trail

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(double distance)
        Sets the length of the Trail. Observers of Trail are notified of the change if this method is called subsequently to construction.
        Parameters:
        distance - the length of the Trail
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the passed argument is negative.

      • trailOpen

        public boolean trailOpen(Activity a)
        Checks if the Trail is open for a specified Activity, based on maintenance status, whether or not snow is needed for the Activity, and the amount of snow currently on the Trail.
        Parameters:
        a - the Activity to check for
        Returns:
        false if the Trail is closed, the Activity is not allowed, or there is not enough/too much snow on the Trail for the Activity (depending on whether or not snow is required for the Activity). Returns true otherwise.

      • allow

        public boolean allow(Activity a)
        Checks if a specified Activity is on the list of allowable activities for the Trail.
        Parameters:
        a - the Activity to check for.
        Returns:
        true if the Activity is allowed on the Trail, false otherwise.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Trail t)
        Compares two Trails based on their name fields using lexicographical ordering.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Trail>
        Parameters:
        t - the Trail to compare to.
        Returns:
        a negative integer if this Trail lexicographically precedes the passed Trail, a positive integer if this Trail lexicographically follows the passed Trail, or 0 if the passed Trail has the same name as this Trail.
